oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Model 1840 cavalry saber belonged of Anthony Pate Thackston, Co.G, 28th Tenn. Inf. Regt., CSA
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: 1840 cavalry saber of Anthony Pate Thackston, Co. G, 28th Tenn. Inf. Regt., CSA. He was killed in action at Baton Rouge, La., August 5, 1862. Thackston was from Sullivan's Bend in Smith County, Tenn. and often went by Anthony Wayne Thackston. According to; his descendants he was elected 2nd Lt., Co. G, 28th Tenn. Inf. Regt., CSA. His saber was made by S. Hoppe Sons, Solingen, Germany and was imported during the war. The sword was sent to his family after his death.
